messages.content:
Categorize this IT Ticket:

deactivate automatic for complaints tuesday december pm logged has raised root cause analysis hi please disable raising action feedback tickets thanks tuesday december pm re logged has raised root cause analysis hello raised because complaint logged complaint closed close others raising same issue disable automatic feature complaint thanks leader ext december re logged has raised root cause analysis hi more complaint than si also help understand reason logged way name user example thanks november pm logged has raised root cause analysis dear please advised has logged assigned queue has entered details reference number summary has raised root cause analysis priority low resolution target date description october pm change creates nightmare importance high hello struggling almost two weeks nightmare after had change let by saying special work remote via work also travelling lot depend mobile devices sometimes personal each these configured works well except fatal forced change every forced change fatal because days transitory phase gets rejected other devices worse because nightmare after two weeks problem randomly other aforementioned devices rejects work while then suddenly ask which reject unable verify name say completely random moment same bricked both possible combination imaginable make completely crazy out without changing setting working again which mean necessarily work same thought influence specify make difference which works work irrespective name give instance tens experienced recently minutes ago rejected after worked well morning after work over weekend etc while writing noticed minutes ago started working again story latest two weeks please help thanks code ext ref msg

message.reasoning:
**Categorizing IT Tickets**

I'm looking at the need to categorize an IT ticket. The user provided a lengthy text that touches on deactivating features, complaints, root cause analysis, and feedback issues. This seems to be related to software or IT operations. It could fit into several categories: “Administrative rights” might be appropriate since it relates to system changes. However, it could also fall under “Miscellaneous” or “Access.” I need to decide the best fit from the options available.**Analyzing Complaint Automation Issues**

The user seems to be asking for help with disabling an automatic feature related to complaint escalation. Their message is quite lengthy and includes multiple references to root cause analysis, logged complaints, and issues with devices. It looks like they’re experiencing a frustrating situation with forced changes causing device rejections and difficulties while working remotely. I need to clarify the best steps for addressing this situation and whether it falls under complaint management or IT support categories.**Determining Ticket Category**

I need to figure out the best category for this ticket. The user is requesting to disable feedback tickets and an automatic feature, which suggests a system configuration change, so "Administrative rights" seems applicable. While "Internal Project" could apply if it were about ongoing work, it doesn’t quite fit here. "Access" isn't relevant either. Given that the ticket doesn’t fall under hardware or storage, I think "Administrative rights" is the best choice for this issue.**Creating JSON Response**

I need to provide a JSON object with the appropriate category based on the format. The system specifies that the category should be "Administrative rights." Since the requirement states the output must be an object with a "category" property, I’ll format it accordingly. The final output will be: {"category":"Administrative rights"}. I’ll make sure to keep it simple and stick to the exact format without any extra text. That way, I’m giving the user exactly what they need!
